meanings.definition: To take on a particular quality or appearance without proof or confirmation.
meanings.sent1: She would often assumer a cheerful attitude even when she felt sad inside.
meanings.sent2: He tends to assumer that everyone likes the same things he does.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to assumer the role of the king of the house, demanding treats and attention.
meanings.sent4: The fog assumered a mysterious and eerie presence as it enveloped the town.
meanings.sent5: The magician's cloak assumered a shimmering glow under the stage lights.

meanings.definition: To take for granted or suppose something to be true without evidence.
meanings.sent1: Don't just assumer that everything will work out perfectly without any effort.
meanings.sent2: She would often assumer that her friends would always be there for her no matter what.
meanings.sent3: The detective had to assumer the suspect's innocence until proven guilty.
meanings.sent4: The old superstition made people assumer that black cats bring bad luck.
meanings.sent5: The children would assumer that the tooth fairy would leave money under their pillows for each lost tooth.

meanings.definition: One who takes on a particular role or responsibility.
meanings.sent1: The team captain was a natural assumer, always leading by example.
meanings.sent2: She was the designated assumer of the family's holiday planning every year.
meanings.sent3: The little girl became the assumer of the class pet's care, making sure it had food and water.
meanings.sent4: The CEO was the primary assumer of the company's success or failure.
meanings.sent5: The superhero was seen as the assumer of justice, fighting crime and protecting the city.
